text: - Recurrent pneumonia - Severe global developmental delay - Severe postnatal growth retardation - Short long bone - Sparse eyebrow - Split hand - Talipes equinovarus - Thickened calvaria - Thoracolumbar kyphoscoliosis - Umbilical hernia - Varus deformity of humeral neck - Wide intermamillary distance - The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database.
